sentences.english: The celebrations came to an end as Washington began preparations for the state funeral for Johnson.
sentences.chinese: 庆祝活动结束的华盛顿开始准备举行国葬的约翰逊。

sentences.english: When he died he was given a state funeral.
sentences.chinese: 他去世后，为他举行了国葬。

sentences.english: Saturday his body will be flown to Washington for a state funeral.
sentences.chinese: 星期六他的遗体将被空运到华盛顿进行国葬。

sentences.english: Mary's Church in Auckland, during his state funeral January 22, 2008.
sentences.chinese: 这场国葬在纽西兰奥克兰的圣玛莉教堂内举行。

definition: to give to the departed/to confer (a title) posthumously
to mourn/to pay last respects/mourning/memorial (service etc)
to suspend business at the imperial court on account of a misfortune
Mt Babao Revolutionary Cemetery in Haidian district of Beijing
pinyin: Ba1 bao3 Shan1 Ge2 ming4 Gong1 mu4

definition: a worship ceremony for the dead/to offer sacrifice (to ancestors)/a libation
father or founder of a nation/Father of the Republic (Sun Yat-sen)
